snippet: Major League Baseball, team executives and baseball observers are emphasizing exit velocity, the speed of the ball as it leaves the bat, as a way to evaluate hitters.
abstract: Major League Baseball teams have honed in on 'exit velocity' as key measure for hitters; term refers to speed of ball as it leaves bat, and can give strong indication of a hitter's home-run potential; statistic was decisive factor in New York Mets decision to choose first baseman Lucas Duda over Ike Davis.
lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball, team executives and baseball observers are emphasizing exit velocity, the speed of the ball as it leaves the bat, as a way to evaluate hitters.

headline.main: New Way to Judge Hitters? It’s Rocket Science, Sort Of
headline.print_headline: New Way to Judge Hitters? It’s Rocket Science, Sort Of
